content: AUM growth year-over-year, which was over $9 billion or 10%, came from both our specialized funds and customized separate accounts. At quarter end, total fee earning AUM stood at $54.9 billion and grew $8.8 billion or 19% relative to the prior year, stemming from positive fund flows across both our specialized funds and our customized separate accounts. Over the past 12 months, we achieved positive net inflows of $4.1 billion, representing growth of 23% relative to the prior year period. Revenue increased $11.9 million or 16% over the prior year period due to  from existing clients, the addition of several accounts and continued investment activity. Revenue from our advisory reporting and other offerings decreased $1.5 million compared to the prior year period due primarily due to a decrease in revenue from our distribution management business, partially offset by increases in fund reimbursement and reporting revenue.
